name.description: A name to show for the workspace folder.

extensions.description: An array of extensions that should be installed into the container.

settings.description: Machine specific settings that should be copied into the container.

forwardPorts.description: Ports that are forwarded from the container to the local machine.

remoteUser.description: The user VS Code Server will be started with. The default is the same user as the container.

initializeCommand.description: A command to run locally before anything else. If this is a single string, it will be run in a shell. If this is an array of strings, it will be run as a single command without shell.

postCreateCommand.description: A command to run after creating the container. If this is a single string, it will be run in a shell. If this is an array of strings, it will be run as a single command without shell.

postStartCommand.description: A command to run after starting the container. If this is a single string, it will be run in a shell. If this is an array of strings, it will be run as a single command without shell.

postAttachCommand.description: A command to run after attaching to the container. If this is a single string, it will be run in a shell. If this is an array of strings, it will be run as a single command without shell.

devPort.description: The port VS Code can use to connect to its backend.

userEnvProbe.description: User environment probe to run. The default is none.

appPort.description: Application ports that are exposed by the container. This can be a single port or an array of ports. Each port can be a number or a string. A number is mapped to the same port on the host. A string is passed to Docker unchanged and can be used to map ports differently, e.g. "8000:8010".

containerUser.description: The user the container will be started with. The default is the user on the Docker image.

updateRemoteUserUID.description: Controls whether on Linux the container's user should be updated with the local user's UID and GID. On by default.

mounts.description: Mount points to set up when creating the container. See Docker's documentation for the --mount option for the supported syntax.

runArgs.description: The arguments required when starting in the container.

shutdownAction.description: Action to take when the VS Code window is closed. The default is to stop the container.

overrideCommand.description: Whether to overwrite the command specified in the image. The default is true.

workspaceFolder.description: The path of the workspace folder inside the container.

workspaceMount.description: The --mount parameter for docker run. The default is to mount the project folder at /workspaces/$project.

dockerfile.description: The location of the Dockerfile that defines the contents of the container. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

context.description: The location of the context folder for building the Docker image. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

dockerFile.description: The location of the Dockerfile that defines the contents of the container. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

context.description: The location of the context folder for building the Docker image. The path is relative to the folder containing the `devcontainer.json` file.

target.description: Target stage in a multi-stage build.

image.description: The docker image that will be used to create the container.

dockerComposeFile.description: The name of the docker-compose file(s) used to start the services.

service.description: The service you want to work on.

runServices.description: An array of services that should be started and stopped.

workspaceFolder.description: The path of the workspace folder inside the container.

shutdownAction.description: Action to take when the VS Code window is closed. The default is to stop the containers.
